actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Social Security.

official_title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress that the age of retirement under the social security program should remain at sixty-five, and that the Congress will not enact legislation to raise such age.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Expresses the sense of Congress that the retirement age under the social security program should remain at 65 and that Congress should not enact legislation to raise such age.

titles.title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress that the age of retirement under the social security program should remain at sixty-five, and that the Congress will not enact legislation to raise such age.
